heading: Deaths
txt: Bob Nieman, American baseball player (b. 1927)

heading: Deaths
txt: Ray Milland, Welsh-American actor and director (b. 1907)

entities.title: Ray Milland
entities.description: Ray Milland was a British-American actor and film director. His screen career ran from 1929 to 1985, and he is best remembered for his Academy Award-winning portrayal of an alcoholic writer in Billy Wilder's The Lost Weekend (1945) and also for such roles as a sophisticated leading man opposite John Wayne's corrupt character in Reap the Wild Wind (1942), the murder-plotting husband in Alfred Hitch

heading: Deaths
txt: Andy Gibb, Australian singer-songwriter and actor (b. 1958)

entities.title: Andy Gibb
entities.description: Andrew Roy Gibb was an English singer and songwriter. He was the younger brother of the Bee Gees: Barry, Robin and Maurice Gibb.

heading: Deaths
txt: Giorgos Zampetas, Greek bouzouki player and composer (b. 1925)

entities.title: Giorgos Zampetas
entities.description: Giorgos Zampetas was a well-known bouzouki musician. His origins are from the island of Kythnos.

entities.title: Bouzouki
entities.description: The bouzouki, also spelled buzuki or buzuci, is a musical instrument popular in Greece. It is a member of the long-necked lute family, with a round body with a flat top and a long neck with a fretted fingerboard. It has steel strings and is played with a plectrum producing a sharp metallic sound, reminiscent of a mandolin but pitched lower. There are two main types of bouzouki: the trichordo (thre

heading: Deaths
txt: Ross Hunter, American film producer (b. 1926)

entities.title: Ross Hunter
entities.description: Ross Hunter was an American film and television producer and actor. Hunter is best known for producing light comedies such as Pillow Talk (1959), and the glamorous melodramas Magnificent Obsession (1954), Imitation of Life (1959), and Back Street (1961).

heading: Deaths
txt: LaVern Baker, American singer and actress (b. 1929)

entities.title: LaVern Baker
entities.description: Delores LaVern Baker was an American R&B singer who had several hit records on the pop chart in the 1950s and early 1960s. Her most successful records were "Tweedle Dee" (1955), "Jim Dandy" (1956), and "I Cried a Tear" (1958).

heading: Deaths
txt: Lloyd Bridges, American actor and director (b. 1913)

entities.title: Lloyd Bridges
entities.description: Lloyd Vernet Bridges Jr. was an American film, stage and television actor who starred in a number of television series and appeared in more than 150 feature films. He was the father of four children, including the actors Beau Bridges and Jeff Bridges. He started his career as a contract performer for Columbia Pictures, appearing in films such as Sahara (1943), A Walk in the Sun (1945), Little Big

heading: Deaths
txt: Oswaldo Guayasamín, Ecuadorian painter and sculptor (b. 1919)

entities.title: Oswaldo Guayasamín
entities.description: Oswaldo Guayasamín was an Ecuadorian painter and sculptor of Kichwa and Mestizo heritage.

heading: Deaths
txt: Dave Allen, Irish-English comedian, actor, and screenwriter (b. 1936)

entities.title: Dave Allen (comedian)
entities.description: David Tynan O'Mahony, known professionally as Dave Allen, was an Irish observational comedian and satirist.

heading: Deaths
txt: Anna Moffo, American soprano (b. 1932)

entities.title: Anna Moffo
entities.description: Anna Moffo was an American opera singer, television personality, and actress. One of the leading lyric-coloratura sopranos of her generation, she possessed a warm and radiant voice of considerable range and agility. Noted for her physical beauty, she was nicknamed "La Bellissima".

heading: Deaths
txt: Ernie Ladd, American football player and wrestler (b. 1938)

entities.title: Ernie Ladd
entities.description: Ernest Ladd, nicknamed "The Big Cat", was an American professional football player and professional wrestler. A standout athlete in high school, Ladd attended Grambling State University on a basketball scholarship before being drafted in 1961 by the San Diego Chargers of the American Football League (AFL). Ladd found success in the AFL as one of the largest players in professional football history

heading: Deaths
txt: Muhammad Sayyid Tantawy, Egyptian scholar and academic (b. 1928)

entities.title: Muhammad Sayyid Tantawy
entities.description: Muhammad Sayyid Tantawy, also referred to as Tantawi, was an influential Islamic scholar in Egypt. From 1986 to 1996, he was the grand Mufti of Egypt. In 1996, president Hosni Mubarak appointed him as the Grand Imam of Al-Azhar, a position he retained until his death in 2010.

heading: Deaths
txt: Corey Haim, Canadian actor (b. 1971)

heading: Deaths
txt: Bill Blackbeard, American author and illustrator (b. 1926)

entities.title: Bill Blackbeard
entities.description: William Elsworth Blackbeard, better known as Bill Blackbeard, was a writer-editor and the founder-director of the San Francisco Academy of Comic Art, a comprehensive collection of comic strips and cartoon art from American newspapers. heading: Deaths
txt: Jean Giraud, French author and illustrator (b. 1938)

entities.title: Jean Giraud
entities.description: Jean Henri Gaston Giraud was a French artist, cartoonist, and writer who worked in the Franco-Belgian bandes dessinées (BD) tradition. Giraud garnered worldwide acclaim under the pseudonym Moebius, as well as Gir outside the English-speaking world, used for the Blueberry series—his most successful creation in the non-English speaking parts of the world—and his Western-themed paintings. entities.title: Nobel Prize in Chemistry
entities.description: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry is awarded annually by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences to scientists in the various fields of chemistry. It is one of the five Nobel Prizes established by the will of Alfred Nobel in 1895, awarded for outstanding contributions in chemistry, physics, literature, peace, and physiology or medicine. heading: Deaths
txt: Princess Lilian, Duchess of Halland, British born Swedish Princess (b.1915)

entities.title: Princess Lilian, Duchess of Halland
entities.description: Princess Lilian of Sweden, Duchess of Halland, was a Welsh fashion model who became a member of the Swedish royal family through her 1976 marriage to Prince Bertil, Duke of Halland (1912–1997). As such, she was a paternal aunt of King Carl XVI Gustaf of Sweden and a maternal aunt of Queen Margrethe II of Denmark and Queen Anne-Marie of Greece.

heading: Deaths
txt: Richard Glatzer, American director, producer, and screenwriter (b. 1952)

entities.title: Richard Glatzer
entities.description: Richard Glatzer was an American writer and director.

heading: Deaths
txt: Ken Adam, German-English production designer and art director (b. 1921)

entities.title: Ken Adam
entities.description: Sir Kenneth Adam was a German-British movie production designer, best known for his set designs for the James Bond films of the 1960s and 1970s, as well as for Dr. Strangelove.

heading: Deaths
txt: Roberto Perfumo, Argentinian footballer and sportscaster

heading: Deaths
txt: Jovito Salonga, Filipino lawyer and politician, 14th President of the Senate of the Philippines (b. 1920)

entities.title: President of the Senate of the Philippines
entities.description: The president of the Senate of the Philippines more popularly known as the Senate president, is the presiding officer and the highest-ranking official of the Senate of the Philippines, and third highest and most powerful official in the Government of the Philippines. heading: Deaths
txt: Anita Brookner, English novelist and art historian (b. 1928)
